meanings.definition: To break or split into small, sharp pieces
meanings.sent1: The wood was splintering into tiny shards.
meanings.sent2: Carefully, she removed the splintering pieces from the old fence.
meanings.sent3: The kids found joy in splintering the old chair for their art project.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was splintering into a million pieces after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the splintering glass echoed through the empty house.

meanings.definition: To cause division or fragmentation within a group or organization
meanings.sent1: The disagreement was splintering the once-united team.
meanings.sent2: The controversial decision was splintering the community.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having a pizza party was splintering the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The rumors were splintering the trust between the friends.
meanings.sent5: The new policy was splintering the company into different factions.
